thread.title: Ground News - Voices of the Community: Central Virginia celebrates Black History Month
thread.title_full: Ground News - Voices of the Community: Central Virginia celebrates Black History Month

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Voices of the Community: Central Virginia celebrates Black History Month
text:
Summary by Ground News The Cloquet High School student organization BIPOC celebrated Black History Month on Wednesday. The group invited guest speaker Jay Jackson to talk about his lived experiences of being Black. The event was made possible through grants from the Cloquet Educational Foundation. The BipOC group was founded by students in 2022 to advance diversity awareness among the student body. Share menu 20 Articles 20 Articles All Left Center Right
CNN Lean Left High Factuality Media Conglomerate: Warner Bros. Discovery Black History is being celebrated in this unlikely country as February comes to an end Josephine Apraku, who is Black and German, writes that over the years, “Black Germans have faced the challenge of figuring out where we fit in the African diaspora.”

Scripps Company Voices of the Community: Central Virginia celebrates Black History Month RICHMOND, Va. -- Much like the James River runs through the heart of Richmond, Black History runs through the heart of Central Virginia. And throughout this February CBS 6 has been dedicated to showcasing the stories of the black community right here in the RVA.From a former enslaved person who made a daring escape inside of a box, to the former Virginia State University Cheerleaders still turning heads nearly three decades after they graduated,…
